intro: Ecastaphyllum brownei var. psilocalyx, commonly known as the slender-leaved ecastaphyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves that are typically glossy and arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a tubular corolla, typical of the Rubiaceae family. This variant is distinguished by its reduced calyx lobes, giving it a unique appearance compared to other members of the species.
